items.title: Passmonster Bassey topt de lijstjes op de Afrika Cup
items.summary: Zaterdag eindigt voor Nigeria de Afrika Cup. In de strijd om plek drie nemen The Super Eagles het op tegen Egypte. Daarin heeft bondscoach √âric Chelle in ieder geval √©√©n troef in handen: passmonster Calvin Bassey.

items.title: Oliver Glasner to leave Crystal Palace in summer, Manchester City close on Gu√©hi: football ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ The latest football news going into the weekend ‚öΩ Premier League preview | Follow on Bluesky | Mail us A very poor 9/15 from me. Afcon is moving to a four-year cycle, a decision the Confederation of African Football has been accused of forcing through without proper consultation. Ed Aarons and Romain Molina report: Several presidents of African football federations have told the Guardian they were not informed of the decision until it was surprisingly announced by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, on 20 December, prompting claims that the confederation breached its statutes by failing to seek approval at a general assembly. Continue reading...

items.summary: Manchester City are closing in on the signing of Marc Gu√©hi from Crystal Palace, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Carrick shrugs off criticism from ex-United players
items.summary: Michael Carrick has said he is "not bothered" by personal criticism made by Roy Keane.

items.title: Rose Lavelle named U.S. Women's Player of Year
items.summary: Gotham FC and United States women's national team midfielder Rose Lavelle has been voted U.S. Soccer's Female Player of the Year for 2025.

items.title: Pulisic stays on bench as Rabiot inspires Milan win
items.summary: AC Milan won 3-1 at in-form Como on Thursday, with Adrien Rabiot winning a penalty and then scoring two goals.

items.title: Liverpool keeper gets six-game ban after racism claim
items.summary: Liverpool goalkeeper Rafaela Borggrafe receives a six-game ban for using discriminatory language towards a team-mate.

items.title: Hier kijk je vrijdag live naar de loting voor de kwartfinale van de KNVB Beker
items.summary: Zeven van de acht kwartfinalisten in de Eurojackpot KNVB Beker zijn bekend. De laatste kwartfinalist komt uit het duel tussen De Treffers en NEC. Hieronder lees je wanneer de loting plaatsvindt, welke ploegen er in de koker gaan en waar de loting wordt uitgezonden.

items.title: Donyell Malen leaves Aston Villa for Roma on loan, Sunderland sign Jocelin Ta Bi
items.summary: Roma have ¬£21.6m option to buy forward Winger Ta Bi arrives from Maccabi Netanya Donyell Malen has left Aston Villa after only a year with the club to join Roma. The Serie A side have signed Malen on loan with an option to buy. The loan fee is reported to be ¬£1.7m, with the fee should the deal be made permanent understood to be ¬£21.6m. That will only come into force should certain conditions are met. Continue reading...

items.title: Arbeloa helpt geruchten over vermeende sneer naar Alonso de wereld uit
items.summary: √Ålvaro Arbeloa heeft nooit bedoeld om een kwaad woord over Xabi Alonso te zeggen. Dat maakte de nieuwbakken trainer van Real Madrid vrijdag duidelijk op de persconferentie in aanloop naar zijn competitiedebuut tegen Levante. In dat duel kan hij weer beschikken over sterspeler Kylian Mbapp√©.

items.title: Former Man Utd players' comments 'irrelevant' - Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick brands the noise generated around Manchester United by former players "irrelevant" and says Roy Keane's personal comments did not bother him.

items.title: Geblesseerde Meerdink waarschuwt: 'Ik ben nog nooit zo hongerig geweest'
items.summary: AZ-spits Mexx Meerdink zit nog altijd in de lappenmand. De jonge aanvaller liep tijdens zijn tweede training ooit bij het 'grote' Oranje een liesblessure op die hem nog altijd aan de zijlijn houdt. Na een periode van radiostilte stond Meerdink AZ TV te woord.

items.title: Bahrain Darts Masters LIVE! Littler faces Price in blockbuster clash
Liverpool‚Äôs Rafaela Borggr√§fe given six-game ban after FA finds she made racist remark
items.summary: Goalkeeper has served five matches of the suspension Reference to skin colour overheard by club colleagues The Liverpool goalkeeper Rafaela Borggr√§fe was given a six-game ban by the Football Association after being found to have made a racist comment that involved reference to skin colour. Borggr√§fe has served five matches of that suspension. She accepted the sanction and was also ordered to enrol on an education programme after an FA investigation into the language, which was overheard by some staff and teammates. Continue reading...

items.title: Palace manager Glasner to leave at end of season
items.summary: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner confirms he will leave the club when his contract expires at the end of the season.

items.title: Man City agree ¬£20m deal to sign Palace captain Guehi
items.summary: Manchester City agree a deal in principle to sign Crystal Palace and England centre-back Marc Guehi in January for ¬£20m.

items.title: Boots from Easter Bunny and teenage parties - Glasner tells his story
items.summary: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his background and career in football.

items.title: Van Persie is zijn glimlach kwijt: 'Bij Feyenoord moet je veel meer winnen'
items.summary: Het is crisis bij Feyenoord, en dat weet trainer Robin van Persie maar al te goed. De normaal zo goedlachse Rotterdammer is ronduit ontevreden over de huidige clubsituatie en vond het misplaatst om met een glimlach op de persconferentie te verschijnen. 'Dat is in deze setting niet gepast.'

items.title: Glasner to leave Palace at end of season: 'I want a new challenge'
items.summary: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner has revealed he will leave the club when his contract expires at the end of the season, citing his desire for a "new challenge" after nearly two years at Selhurst Park.

items.title: O'Neill hopeful of January signings ahead of Hearts clash - live on Sky!
items.summary: Celtic manager Martin O'Neill is hopeful of getting reinforcements in for their crucial clash with Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts - live on Sky Sports.
